title: Topic 003 Question 005
body: A company has two subnets in a virtual network named VNet1. The subnets are named SubnetA and SubnetB. The company uses a site-to-site (S2S) VPN in SubnetB to connect its on-premises environment to Azure.
You deploy an Azure SQL Database named SQL1. You configure a service endpoint in SubnetA for Microsoft SQL.
On-premises users report that they are unable to access SQL1 by using a private IP address.
You need to resolve the issue for the on-premises users.
options: Configure a DNS record for the private IP address of SQL1.
Configure a network security group (NSG) to allow port 1433 on SubnetA.
Configure a service endpoint on SubnetB.
Deploy a private endpoint for SQL1.
Deploy an Azure ExpressRoute circuit for VNet1.
